column4: unless you want the CD to have packages for an offline installation, there is no difference to you
since you will probably want to update the packages on the cd after installing them anyway
or you could manually edit /etc/passwd as root if you're into doing things wrong
well you didn't do it yourself

like adding the wine repository to get the bleeding edge version of wine
As long as those repositories are designed for that particular release of Ubuntu.
It is safer to use package mangagement whenever possible.
Many source packages do not provide a make uninstall target.
Thats not always feasible or desired.
Discarding that, no. If you feel comfortable with it you may install from source.
